items: Start by placing a kettlebell on the ground in front of you.
Assume a push-up position with your hands on the kettlebell handles.
Lower your body towards the kettlebell by bending your elbows.
Push your body back up to the starting position by straightening your arms.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Strengthens the legs, glutes, and core muscles
Improves balance and stability
Increases flexibility in the hips and groin area
Engages multiple muscle groups for a full-body workout
Can be modified for different fitness levels and goals
Can be done with minimal equipment and space
Chest muscles
Shoulder muscles
Triceps muscles
Core muscles
kettlebell push-up
kettlebell bench press
kettlebell floor press
kettlebell incline press
kettlebell decline press
